symbolic_scroll.name: SyntheonSymbolicRules
symbolic_scroll.description: Full set of induced, generalized, and modular symbolic rules for ARC-AGI-2 as learned and refined by the GEN-I engine. Each rule is structured for composability, explainability, and match to common grid transformations and object manipulations in ARC tasks. Rules may be combined, sequenced, or selected by meta-logic.

rule.name: TilePatternExpansion
rule.pattern: input 2Ã—2 tile â‡’ output 6Ã—6 by 3Ã—3 tiling
rule.description: Repeats the 2Ã—2 input tile in a 3Ã—3 grid to form a 6Ã—6 output.

examples.output: [[a, b, a, b, a, b], [c, d, c, d, c, d], [a, b, a, b, a, b], [c, d, c, d, c, d], [a, b, a, b, a, b], [c, d, c, d, c, d]]

rule.name: MirrorBandExpansion
rule.pattern: mirror left half across vertical axis rowâ€‘wise
rule.description: Reflects each row to double width, creating band symmetry.
rule.logic: for each row in grid: output_row = row + reversed(row)

rule.name: FrameFillConvergence
rule.pattern: draw solid frame colour 3, fill centre colour 1
rule.description: Paints the outer border with colour 3 and fills centre with colour 1.
rule.logic: output = grid of 1s set output borders to 3

rule.name: ColorReplacement
rule.pattern: replace color X with Y everywhere
rule.description: Substitutes all cells of a given color with another specified color.
rule.logic: for each cell: if cell == X: cell = Y

rule.name: MajorityFill
rule.pattern: fill region/object with most common color
rule.description: Replaces all empty or target regions with the most common color in the input.
rule.logic: majority = mode(all colors) for cell in region: cell = majority
rule.condition: region detected, input has single majority color

rule.name: DiagonalFlip
rule.description: Transposes the input grid (swaps rows and columns).

rule.name: CropToBoundingBox
rule.pattern: crop grid to nonzero/colorful bounding box
rule.description: Crops the grid to the smallest rectangle containing all nonzero (non-background) cells.
rule.logic: find min/max rows/cols with color != 0 crop grid to this bounding box
rule.condition: output area < input area; content preserved

rule.name: RemoveObjects
rule.pattern: remove all isolated objects of color X
rule.description: Removes connected components of a specific color (object deletion).
rule.logic: for obj in connected_components(color=X): delete obj
rule.condition: at least one object of color X exists

rule.name: DuplicateRowsOrColumns
rule.description: Replicates every row (or column) of the input grid a fixed number of times to increase output size.
rule.logic: for row in input: for i in range(n): output.append(row)
rule.condition: output shape = input shape Ã— n (rows or cols)

rule.name: ReplaceBorderWithColor
rule.pattern: set grid border to color X
rule.description: Recolors the border of the grid to a specified color X.
rule.logic: output[0,:] = X; output[-1,:] = X; output[:,0] = X; output[:,-1] = X

rule.name: FillHoles
rule.pattern: fill all holes (0 regions) inside objects
rule.description: Fills all interior empty regions (holes) of objects with their surrounding color.
rule.logic: for region in holes(input): fill region with color of enclosing object

rule.name: ObjectCounting
rule.pattern: output the count of objects as color or grid size
rule.description: Counts objects (connected components) and encodes the count as a color or grid output.
rule.logic: count = number of connected components encode count as color or output grid
rule.condition: output is a single cell or special color

rule.name: ColorSwapping
rule.description: Swaps every occurrence of two colors (e.g., redâ†”blue) in the grid.

rule.name: SequentialRuleApplication
rule.pattern: apply rules R then S in sequence
rule.description: Applies rule R to the input, then applies rule S to the result (for multi-phase transformations).
rule.logic: out1 = R(input) out2 = S(out1) return out2

rule.name: ConditionalRuleSwitch
rule.pattern: if (predicate), apply rule R; else rule S
rule.description: Conditionally applies one of two rules based on a property of the input grid.
rule.logic: if predicate(input): return R(input) else: return S(input)

rule.name: RotatePattern
rule.description: Rotates the entire grid by the specified number of degrees clockwise.
